intro: Malvastrum sandemanii, commonly known as the sandeman's mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
